````  
# EdgeR()  
##   
EdgeREdgeR  
##   
`Encode``HepG2``total RNA-Seq`  
`Encode``total RNA-Seq`  

##   
###   
`Encode``gene_id``expected_count`EdgeR  
`ENSGENSG1515.`  
**:**  

> rep1=read.table("./ENCFF944RFV.tsv",header=T)  
> rep2=read.table("./ENCFF529HSE.tsv",header=T)  
> rep3=read.table("./ENCFF396FZT.tsv",header=T)  
> rep4=read.table("./ENCFF103FSL.tsv",header=T)  
> norm1=read.table("~/Project/Normal_tissue/Liver/RNA/ENCFF780YUS.tsv",header = T)  
> norm2=read.table("~/Project/Normal_tissue/Liver/RNA/ENCFF846SOK.tsv",header = T)  
<!--more-->  
**gene_id:**  
rep1:  

> rep1 = rep1[grep('ENSG',test\$gene_id,invert = F),]    
> rep1\$gene_id = substr(rep1\$gene_id,1,15)  
> rep1 = aggregate(expected_count ~ gene_id , data = rep1,sum)  

repnorm  

**:**  

> count=data.frame(rep1\$gene_id,rep1\$expected_count,rep2\$expected_count,rep3\$expected_count,rep4\$expected_count,norm1\$expected_count,norm2\$expected_count)  
> colnames(count)=c('gene_id','rep1','rep2','rep3','rep4','norm1','norm2')  
> rownames(count)=count$gene_id  
> count = count[,-c(1)]  

count:  

![](/EdgeR(2)/1.png)  

**:**  

``  
````  
1.``:  
`The filtering should be based on the grouping factors or treatment factors that will be involved in the differential expression teststested for, rather than on blocking variables that are not of scientific interest in themselves.`  
2.``:  
(1) :`The classic edgeR pipeline`--->`edgeR uses the quantile-adjusted conditional maximum likelihood (qCML) method for experiments with single factor.`  
(2) :`More complex experiments (glm functionality)`--->`Generalized linear models (GLMs) are an extension of classical linear models to nonnormally distributed response data`

Post.title: EdgeR
Post._content:
# EdgeR [https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/vignettes/edgeR/inst/doc/edgeRUsersGuide.pdf](https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/vignettes/edgeR/inst/doc/edgeRUsersGuide.pdf)) ## `Encode``NCI-H460``total RNA-Seq``Encode` `Encode`,`total RNA-Seq` ![](/EdgeR/1.png) ## ### ***Files need to contain two columns, one for the counts and one for a gene identifier.*** Encode: ![](/EdgeR/2.png) ***Note that edgeR is designed to work with actual read counts. void merge(int a[],int t[],int start,int end){
    //1
    if(start - end <= 1){return;}
    int mid = start + ((start - end) >>  1);
    //
    merge(a,t,start,mid);
    merge(a,t,mid,end);
    //merge_sort
    //
    int s = start;
    int s1 = start;
    int ed1 = mid;
    int s2 = mid + 1;
    int ed2 = end;
    while(s1 <= ed1 && s2 <= ed2){
        if(a[s1] > a[s2]){
            t[s++] = a[s2++];
        }
        else{
            t[s++] = a[s1++];
        }
    }
    while(s1 <= ed1){
        t[s++] = a[s1++];
    }
    while(s2 <= ed2){
        t[s++] = a[s2++];
    }
}

\(LogN\)\(NlogN\)

# EdgeR() ## EdgeREdgeR ## `Encode``HepG2``total RNA-Seq` `Encode``total RNA-Seq` ## ### `Encode``gene_id``expected_count`EdgeR `ENSGENSG1515.` **:** > rep1=read.table("./ENCFF944RFV.tsv",header=T) > rep2=read.table("./ENCFF529HSE.tsv",header=T) > rep3=read.table("./ENCFF396FZT.tsv",header=T) > rep4=read.table("./ENCFF103FSL.tsv",header=T) > norm1=read.table("~/Project/Normal_tissue/Liver/RNA/ENCFF780YUS.tsv",header = T) > norm2=read.table("~/Project/Normal_tissue/Liver/RNA/ENCFF846SOK.tsv",header = T) **gene_id:** rep1: > rep1 = rep1[grep('ENSG',test\$gene_id,invert = F),] > rep1\$gene_id = substr(rep1\$gene_id,1,15) > rep1 = aggregate(expected_count ~ gene_id , data = rep1,sum) repnorm **:** > count=data.frame(rep1\$gene_id,rep1\$expected_count,rep2\$expected_count,rep3\$expected_count,rep4\$expected_count,norm1\$expected_count,norm2\$expected_count) > colnames(count)=c('gene_id','rep1','rep2','rep3','rep4','norm1','norm2') > rownames(count)=count$gene_id > count = count[,-c(1)] count: ![](1.png)
**:** `` ```` 1.``: `The filtering should be based on the grouping factors or treatment factors that will be involved in the differential expression teststested for, rather than on blocking variables that are not of scientific interest in themselves.` 2.``: (1) :`The classic edgeR pipeline`--->`edgeR uses the quantile-adjusted conditional maximum likelihood (qCML) method for experiments with single factor.` (2) :`More complex experiments (glm functionality)`--->`Generalized linear models (GLMs) are an extension of classical linear models to nonnormally distributed response data` ## : [https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/72513104](https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/72513104) **:** **:**

# EdgeR [https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/vignettes/edgeR/inst/doc/edgeRUsersGuide.pdf](https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/vignettes/edgeR/inst/doc/edgeRUsersGuide.pdf) ## `Encode``NCI-H460``total RNA-Seq``Encode` `Encode`,`total RNA-Seq` ![](1.png) ## ### ***Files need to contain two columns, one for the counts and one for a gene identifier.*** Encode: ![](2.png) ***Note that edgeR is designed to work with actual read counts. We not recommend that predicted transcript abundances are input the edgeR in place of actual counts.*** `gene_id``expected_count`EdgeR
**:** > rep1=read.table("./NCI-H460.totalRNA.geneQA.rep1.tsv",header = TRUE) > rep2=read.table("./NCI-H460.totalRNA.geneQA.rep2.tsv",header = TRUE) > norm1=read.table("./lung.toalRNA.geneQA.rep1.tsv",header = TRUE) > norm2=read.table("./lung.toalRNA.geneQA.rep2.tsv",header = TRUE)
**:** >rep1=rep1[,1:5] >rep1=rep1[,-c(2:4)] rep2norm1norm2
**** > count=merge(norm1,norm2,by="gene\_id") > colnames(count)=c("gene\_id","nomr1","norm2") > count=merge(count,rep1,by='gene\_id') > count=merge(count,rep2,by='gene\_id') > colnames(count)=c('gene\_Id','norm1','norm2','rep1','rep2') > row.names(count)=count$gene\_Id > count=count[,-c(1)] ![](3.png)
**DGEList** > group=c("norm","norm","cancer","cancer") > y=DGEList(counts=count,group = group) ![](4.png) rep1rep2lib.size
**** ![](5.png) `filterByExpr`: > keep=filterByExpr(y,group = group) > y=y[keep,,keep.lib.sizes=FALSE] *keepkeepy* ### Normalization y EdgeRGCSequencing depthEffective library sizes
`y = calcNormFactors(y)` ![](6.png) `norm.factors` *We call the product of the original library size and the scaling factor the effective library size. The effective library size replaces the original library size in all downsteam analyses* `effective library size` `effective library size = original library size * norm.factors`
### **edgeR** *edgeR uses the quantile-adjusted conditional maximum likelihood (qCML) method for experiments with single factor*
: `y = estimateDisp(y)` `et = exactTest(y)` `topTags(et)` ![](7.png) normcancer `et$table` logFC > 2 p < 0.05 `ed = et$table[which(et$table$logFC > 2 & et$table$PValue < 0.05),]` ![](8.png)
**** [https://github.com/twbattaglia/RNAseq-workflow](https://github.com/twbattaglia/RNAseq-workflow) `library(org.Hs.eg.db)` `sy = mapIds(x = org.Hs.eg.db,keys = substr(row.names(ed),1,15),keytype = 'ENSEMBL',column = 'SYMBOL',multiVals = 'first')` `ed$symbol = sy` *ENSGXXXXXXXXXX.XX* ![](9.png) ## 1.GOKEGG 2.

OrgDborg. ontGO3BP, CC, MF,ALL3. pAdjustMethod. cufoff. readable=TRUEIDgene symbol.** _idt_ : ![](1.png)
`dotplot(ego,showCategory = 10)` ![](2.png) `barplot(ego,showCategory = 10)` ![](3.png)
### KEGG GO: `kk=enrichKEGG(te$entrzid,organism="hsa", pvalueCutoff=0.05, pAdjustMethod="BH",qvalueCutoff=0.1)` `kk=setReadable(kk,OrgDb = org.Hs.eg.db,keyType = 'ENTREZID')` KEGGENSEMBLIDENTRZID: `en=mapIds(x = org.Hs.eg.db,keys = ed$symbol,keytype = "SYMBOL",column = "ENTREZID")` `ed$entrzid=en` `te=na.omit(ed)` `barplot(kk,ddrop=T,showCategory =10,title="KEGG Enrichment Pathways")` ![](4.png) **pathview** : [https://cloud.tencent.com/developer/article/1539928](https://cloud.tencent.com/developer/article/1539928) `genem=tee$logFC` `names(genem)=row.names(tee)` `pathview(gene.data = genem,pathway.id = '04514',species = 'hsa')` `pathway.id`id04514Cell adhesion molecules `gene.data`foldchange,cpm `genem`ENTRZID. `species` ![](5.png) ## 1.
